s1.name: Bytecode Outline plugin for Eclipse
s1.p: Bytecode Outline plugin shows disassembled bytecode of current Java editor or class file, allows bytecode compare for Java/class files and shows ASMifier code for current bytecode.
s1.subtitle: Screen shots
Download
s1.p: You can download the plugin from the ObjectWeb Forge site.
s1.subtitle: Installation
s1.p: All what you need to install Bytecode Outline plugin is to unzip the zip file into your %Eclipse%/plugin directory and restart Eclipse. You don't need to do anymore to install Bytecode Outline.
Note: Bytecode Outline tested and works on Eclipse 3.0 / 3.0.1 / 3.1M2
s1.subtitle: Usage
s1.p: To see the bytecode of the current .java or .class file:

ul.li: Window -> Show View -> Other -> Java -> Bytecode

s1.p: To compare the bytecode of two .java or .class files:

ul.li: select two *.class or *.java files -> right click -> Compare with -> Each Other Bytecode
select one *.class or *.java file -> right click -> Compare with -> Another Class Bytecode

s1.p: Compare also works for *.class files included in any referenced *.jar library. Additional details can be found on author home page at http://andrei.gmxhome.de/bytecode/index.html
